meanings.definition: A floating device used in underwater acoustics to detect and transmit sound signals.
meanings.sent1: The sonobuoy was dropped into the ocean to listen for submarines.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use sonobuoys to study marine life beneath the waves.
meanings.sent3: The curious dolphin mistook the sonobuoy for a new plaything.
meanings.sent4: The sonobuoy floated like a vigilant sentinel, capturing the secrets of the deep.
meanings.sent5: The sonobuoy hummed softly, revealing the hidden symphony of the ocean.

meanings.definition: To deploy sonobuoys for the purpose of detecting underwater objects or vessels.
meanings.sent1: The navy plans to sonobuoy the area to locate the missing submarine.
meanings.sent2: They sonobuoyed the region to track the movements of the elusive sea creature.
meanings.sent3: The fishermen decided to sonobuoy the waters in search of the legendary kraken.
meanings.sent4: The researchers sonobuoyed the depths, hoping to uncover ancient shipwrecks.
meanings.sent5: As the team sonobuoys the ocean, they listen intently for any unusual sounds.
